trans-unit.source: Provision HBase clusters on a Virtual Network | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Provision HBase clusters on a Virtual Network | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Get started using HBase in Azure HDInsight. Learn how to create HDInsight HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: Get started using HBase in Azure HDInsight. Learn how to create HDInsight HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network
trans-unit.target: Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create Azure HDInsight HBase clusters on an <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network[1]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create Azure HDInsight HBase clusters on an <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network[1]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: With virtual network integration, HBase clusters can be deployed to the same virtual network as your applications so that applications can communicate with HBase directly.
trans-unit.target: With virtual network integration, HBase clusters can be deployed to the same virtual network as your applications so that applications can communicate with HBase directly.

trans-unit.source: The benefits include:
trans-unit.target: The benefits include:

trans-unit.source: Direct connectivity of the web application to the nodes of the HBase cluster, which enables communication via HBase Java remote procedure call (RPC) APIs.
trans-unit.target: Direct connectivity of the web application to the nodes of the HBase cluster, which enables communication via HBase Java remote procedure call (RPC) APIs.

trans-unit.source: Improved performance by not having your traffic go over multiple gateways and load-balancers.
trans-unit.target: Improved performance by not having your traffic go over multiple gateways and load-balancers.

trans-unit.source: The ability to process sensitive information in a more secure manner without exposing a public endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The ability to process sensitive information in a more secure manner without exposing a public endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <link><linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <link><linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To execute Azure PowerShell scripts, you must run Azure PowerShell as administrator and set the execution policy to RemoteSigned.
trans-unit.target: To execute Azure PowerShell scripts, you must run Azure PowerShell as administrator and set the execution policy to RemoteSigned.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Using the Set-ExecutionPolicy cmdlet[2]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Using the Set-ExecutionPolicy cmdlet[2]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Before running Azure PowerShell scripts, make sure you are connected to your Azure subscription by using the following cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: Before running Azure PowerShell scripts, make sure you are connected to your Azure subscription by using the following cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the following cmdlet to set the current subscription:
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the following cmdlet to set the current subscription:

trans-unit.source: Provision an HBase cluster into a virtual network
trans-unit.target: Provision an HBase cluster into a virtual network

trans-unit.source: Before provisioning an HBase cluster, you need to have an Azure virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Before provisioning an HBase cluster, you need to have an Azure virtual network.

trans-unit.source: To create a virtual network by using the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: To create a virtual network by using the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click NEW in the bottom-left corner, click NETWORK SERVICES, click VIRTUAL NETWORK, and then click QUICK CREATE.
trans-unit.target: Click NEW in the bottom-left corner, click NETWORK SERVICES, click VIRTUAL NETWORK, and then click QUICK CREATE.

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: Name - The name of your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Name - The name of your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Address space - Choose an address space for the virtual network that is large enough to provide addresses for all nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Address space - Choose an address space for the virtual network that is large enough to provide addresses for all nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise the provision will fail.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise the provision will fail.

trans-unit.source: For walking through this tutorial, you can pick any of the three choices.
trans-unit.target: For walking through this tutorial, you can pick any of the three choices.

trans-unit.source: Maximum VM count - Choose one of the maximum virtual machine (VM) counts.
trans-unit.target: Maximum VM count - Choose one of the maximum virtual machine (VM) counts.

trans-unit.source: This value determines the number of possible hosts (VMs) that can be created under the address space.
trans-unit.target: This value determines the number of possible hosts (VMs) that can be created under the address space.

trans-unit.source: For walking through this tutorial, 4096 [CIDR: /20] is sufficient.
trans-unit.target: For walking through this tutorial, 4096 [CIDR: /20] is sufficient.

trans-unit.source: Location - The location must be the same as the HBase cluster that you will create.
trans-unit.target: Location - The location must be the same as the HBase cluster that you will create.

trans-unit.source: DNS server - This tutorial uses an internal Domain Name System (DNS) server provided by Azure, so you can choose None.
trans-unit.target: DNS server - This tutorial uses an internal Domain Name System (DNS) server provided by Azure, so you can choose None.

trans-unit.source: More advanced networking configurations with custom DNS servers are also supported.
trans-unit.target: More advanced networking configurations with custom DNS servers are also supported.

trans-unit.source: For detailed guidance, see <link><linkText>Name Resolution (DNS)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed guidance, see <link><linkText>Name Resolution (DNS)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click CREATE A VIRTUAL NETWORK in the lower-right corner.
trans-unit.target: Click CREATE A VIRTUAL NETWORK in the lower-right corner.

trans-unit.source: The new virtual network name will appear in the list.
trans-unit.target: The new virtual network name will appear in the list.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the Status column shows Created.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the Status column shows Created.

trans-unit.source: In the main pane, click the virtual network you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the main pane, click the virtual network you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click DASHBOARD on the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click DASHBOARD on the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: Under quick glance, make a note of the virtual network ID.
trans-unit.target: Under quick glance, make a note of the virtual network ID.

trans-unit.source: You will need it when provisioning the HBase cluster.
trans-unit.target: You will need it when provisioning the HBase cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click CONFIGURE on the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click CONFIGURE on the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: On the bottom of the page, the default subnet name is Subnet-1.
trans-unit.target: On the bottom of the page, the default subnet name is Subnet-1.

trans-unit.source: You can optionally rename the subnet or add a new subnet for the HBase cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally rename the subnet or add a new subnet for the HBase cluster.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the subnet name; you will need it when provisioning the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the subnet name; you will need it when provisioning the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Verify CIDR(ADDRESS COUNT) for the subnet that will be used for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Verify CIDR(ADDRESS COUNT) for the subnet that will be used for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The address count must be greater than the number of worker nodes plus seven (gateway: 2, head node: 2, Zookeeper: 3).
trans-unit.target: The address count must be greater than the number of worker nodes plus seven (gateway: 2, head node: 2, Zookeeper: 3).

trans-unit.source: For example, if you need a 10-node HBase cluster, the address count for the subnet must be greater than 17 (10+7).
trans-unit.target: For example, if you need a 10-node HBase cluster, the address count for the subnet must be greater than 17 (10+7).

trans-unit.source: Otherwise the deployment will fail.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise the deployment will fail.

trans-unit.source: Click Save on the bottom of the page, if you have updated the subnet values.
trans-unit.target: Click Save on the bottom of the page, if you have updated the subnet values.

trans-unit.source: To add a DNS server virtual machine to the virtual network
trans-unit.target: To add a DNS server virtual machine to the virtual network

trans-unit.source: A DNS server is optional, but necessary in some cases.
trans-unit.target: A DNS server is optional, but necessary in some cases.

trans-unit.source: The procedure has been documented in <link><linkText>Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-dns]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The procedure has been documented in <link><linkText>Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-dns]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Basically, you will need to perform these steps:
trans-unit.target: Basically, you will need to perform these steps:

trans-unit.source: add an Azure virtual machine to the virtual network
trans-unit.target: add an Azure virtual machine to the virtual network

trans-unit.source: set a static IP address for the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: set a static IP address for the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: add the DNS server role to the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: add the DNS server role to the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Assign the DNS server to the virtual network
trans-unit.target: Assign the DNS server to the virtual network

trans-unit.source: To create an Azure Storage account and a Blob storage container to be used by the cluster
trans-unit.target: To create an Azure Storage account and a Blob storage container to be used by the cluster

trans-unit.source: HDInsight clusters use Azure Blob storage for storing data.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight clusters use Azure Blob storage for storing data.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with Hadoop in HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with Hadoop in HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You will need a storage account and a Blob storage container.
trans-unit.target: You will need a storage account and a Blob storage container.

trans-unit.source: The storage account location must match the virtual network location and the cluster location.
trans-unit.target: The storage account location must match the virtual network location and the cluster location.

trans-unit.source: Like other HDInsight clusters, HBase cluster requires an Azure Storage account and a Blob storage container as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: Like other HDInsight clusters, HBase cluster requires an Azure Storage account and a Blob storage container as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: The storage account location must match the virtual network location and the cluster location.
trans-unit.target: The storage account location must match the virtual network location and the cluster location.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with Hadoop in HDInsight[hdinsight-storage]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with Hadoop in HDInsight[hdinsight-storage]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: When you provision an HBase cluster, you have the options to create new or use existing ones.
trans-unit.target: When you provision an HBase cluster, you have the options to create new or use existing ones.

trans-unit.source: This procedure shows you how to create a storage account and a Blob storage container using the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This procedure shows you how to create a storage account and a Blob storage container using the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click NEW in the lower-left corner, point to DATA SERVICES, point to STORAGE, and then click QUICK CREATE.
trans-unit.target: Click NEW in the lower-left corner, point to DATA SERVICES, point to STORAGE, and then click QUICK CREATE.

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values:

trans-unit.source: URL - The name of the Storage account.
trans-unit.target: URL - The name of the Storage account.

trans-unit.source: LOCATION - The location of the Storage account.
trans-unit.target: LOCATION - The location of the Storage account.

trans-unit.source: Make sure it matches the virtual network location.
trans-unit.target: Make sure it matches the virtual network location.

trans-unit.source: Affinity groups are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Affinity groups are not supported.

trans-unit.source: REPLICATION - For testing purposes, use Locally Redundant to reduce the cost.
trans-unit.target: REPLICATION - For testing purposes, use Locally Redundant to reduce the cost.

trans-unit.source: Click CREATE STORAGE ACCOUNT.
trans-unit.target: Click CREATE STORAGE ACCOUNT.

trans-unit.source: You will see the new Storage account in the storage list.
trans-unit.target: You will see the new Storage account in the storage list.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the STATUS of the new Storage account changes to Online.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the STATUS of the new Storage account changes to Online.

trans-unit.source: Click the new Storage account from the list to select it.
trans-unit.target: Click the new Storage account from the list to select it.

trans-unit.source: Click MANAGE ACCESS KEYS from the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click MANAGE ACCESS KEYS from the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the Storage account name and the primary access key (or the secondary access key; either of the keys works).
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the Storage account name and the primary access key (or the secondary access key; either of the keys works).

trans-unit.source: You will need them later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will need them later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: From the top of the page, click CONTAINER.
trans-unit.target: From the top of the page, click CONTAINER.

trans-unit.source: From the bottom of the page, click ADD.
trans-unit.target: From the bottom of the page, click ADD.

trans-unit.source: Enter the container name.
trans-unit.target: Enter the container name.

trans-unit.source: This container will be used as the default container for the HBase cluster.
trans-unit.target: This container will be used as the default container for the HBase cluster.

trans-unit.source: By default, the default container name matches the cluster name.
trans-unit.target: By default, the default container name matches the cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Keep the ACCESS field as Private.
trans-unit.target: Keep the ACCESS field as Private.

trans-unit.source: Click the checkmark to create the container.
trans-unit.target: Click the checkmark to create the container.

trans-unit.source: To provision an HBase cluster by using the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: To provision an HBase cluster by using the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: For information on provisioning a new HBase cluster by using Azure PowerShell, see <link><linkText>Provision an HBase cluster using Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on provisioning a new HBase cluster by using Azure PowerShell, see <link><linkText>Provision an HBase cluster using Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click NEW in the lower-left corner, point to DATA SERVICES, point to HDINSIGHT, and then click CUSTOM CREATE.
trans-unit.target: Click NEW in the lower-left corner, point to DATA SERVICES, point to HDINSIGHT, and then click CUSTOM CREATE.

trans-unit.source: Enter a cluster name, select HBase as the cluster type, select the Windows Server 2012 operating system, select the HDInsight version, and then click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Enter a cluster name, select HBase as the cluster type, select the Windows Server 2012 operating system, select the HDInsight version, and then click the right button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provide details for the HBase cluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provide details for the HBase cluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For an HBase cluster, Windows Server is the only available OS option.
trans-unit.target: For an HBase cluster, Windows Server is the only available OS option.

trans-unit.source: On the Configure Cluster page, enter or select the following:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure Cluster page, enter or select the following:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provide details for the HBase cluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provide details for the HBase cluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Data Nodes
trans-unit.target: Data Nodes

trans-unit.source: Select the number of data nodes you want to deploy. For testing purposes, create a single-node cluster.
trans-unit.target: Select the number of data nodes you want to deploy. For testing purposes, create a single-node cluster.

trans-unit.source: The cluster size limit varies for Azure subscriptions. Contact Azure billing support to increase the limit.
trans-unit.target: The cluster size limit varies for Azure subscriptions. Contact Azure billing support to increase the limit.

trans-unit.source: Region/Virtual Network
trans-unit.target: Region/Virtual Network

trans-unit.source: Select a region or an Azure virtual network, if you have one already created. For this tutorial, select the network that you created earlier, and then select a corresponding subnet. The default name is
trans-unit.target: Select a region or an Azure virtual network, if you have one already created. For this tutorial, select the network that you created earlier, and then select a corresponding subnet. The default name is

trans-unit.source: Subnet-1
trans-unit.target: Subnet-1

trans-unit.source: Head Node Size
trans-unit.target: Head Node Size

trans-unit.source: Select a VM size for the head node.
trans-unit.target: Select a VM size for the head node.

trans-unit.source: Data Node Size
trans-unit.target: Data Node Size

trans-unit.source: Select a VM size for the data nodes.
trans-unit.target: Select a VM size for the data nodes.

trans-unit.source: Zookeeper Size
trans-unit.target: Zookeeper Size

trans-unit.source: Select a VM size for the Zookeeper node.
trans-unit.target: Select a VM size for the Zookeeper node.

trans-unit.source: Based on the choice of VMs, your cost might vary.
trans-unit.target: Based on the choice of VMs, your cost might vary.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses all standard-tier VMs for cluster nodes.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses all standard-tier VMs for cluster nodes.

trans-unit.source: For information on how VM sizes affect your prices, see <html></html>HDInsight Pricing<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: For information on how VM sizes affect your prices, see <html></html>HDInsight Pricing<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Hadoop user name and password to use for this cluster, and then click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Hadoop user name and password to use for this cluster, and then click the right button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provide Storage account for Hadoop HDInsight cluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provide Storage account for Hadoop HDInsight cluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: HTTP User Name
trans-unit.target: HTTP User Name

trans-unit.source: Specify the HDInsight cluster user name.
trans-unit.target: Specify the HDInsight cluster user name.

trans-unit.source: HTTP Password/Confirm Password
trans-unit.target: HTTP Password/Confirm Password

trans-unit.source: Specify the HDInsight cluster user password.
trans-unit.target: Specify the HDInsight cluster user password.

trans-unit.source: Enable remote desktop for cluster
trans-unit.target: Enable remote desktop for cluster

trans-unit.source: Select this check box to specify a username, password, and expiry date for a remote desktop user that can remote into the cluster nodes, once it is provisioned. You can also enable remote desktop later, after the cluster is provisioned. For instructions, see
trans-unit.target: Select this check box to specify a username, password, and expiry date for a remote desktop user that can remote into the cluster nodes, once it is provisioned. You can also enable remote desktop later, after the cluster is provisioned. For instructions, see

trans-unit.source: Connect to HDInsight clusters using RDP
trans-unit.target: Connect to HDInsight clusters using RDP

trans-unit.source: On the Storage Account page, provide the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the Storage Account page, provide the following values:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provide Storage account for Hadoop HDInsight cluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provide Storage account for Hadoop HDInsight cluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Storage Account
trans-unit.target: Storage Account

trans-unit.source: Specify the Azure Storage account that will be used as the default file system for the HDInsight cluster. You can choose one of the three options:
trans-unit.target: Specify the Azure Storage account that will be used as the default file system for the HDInsight cluster. You can choose one of the three options:

trans-unit.source: Use Existing Storage
trans-unit.target: Use Existing Storage

trans-unit.source: Create New Storage
trans-unit.target: Create New Storage

trans-unit.source: Use Storage From Another Subscription
trans-unit.target: Use Storage From Another Subscription

trans-unit.source: Account Name
trans-unit.target: Account Name

trans-unit.source: If you chose to use existing storage, for
trans-unit.target: If you chose to use existing storage, for

trans-unit.source: Account Name
trans-unit.target: Account Name

trans-unit.source: , select an existing storage account. The drop-down lists only the Storage accounts located in the same data center where you chose to provision the cluster.
trans-unit.target: , select an existing storage account. The drop-down lists only the Storage accounts located in the same data center where you chose to provision the cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you chose the
trans-unit.target: If you chose the

trans-unit.source: Create New Storage
trans-unit.target: Create New Storage

trans-unit.source: or
trans-unit.target: or

trans-unit.source: Use Storage From Another Subscription
trans-unit.target: Use Storage From Another Subscription

trans-unit.source: option, you must provide the Storage account name.
trans-unit.target: option, you must provide the Storage account name.

trans-unit.source: Account Key
trans-unit.target: Account Key

trans-unit.source: If you chose the
trans-unit.target: If you chose the

trans-unit.source: Use Storage From Another Subscription
trans-unit.target: Use Storage From Another Subscription

trans-unit.source: option, specify the account key for that Storage account.
trans-unit.target: option, specify the account key for that Storage account.

trans-unit.source: Default Container
trans-unit.target: Default Container

trans-unit.source: Specify the default container on the Storage account that is used as the default file system for the HDInsight cluster. If you chose
trans-unit.target: Specify the default container on the Storage account that is used as the default file system for the HDInsight cluster. If you chose

trans-unit.source: Use Existing Storage
trans-unit.target: Use Existing Storage

trans-unit.source: for the
trans-unit.target: for the

trans-unit.source: Storage Account
trans-unit.target: Storage Account

trans-unit.source: field, and there are no existing containers in that account, the container is created by default with the same name as the cluster name. If a container with the name of the cluster already exists, a sequence number will be appended to the container name. For example, mycontainer1, mycontainer2, and so on. However, if the existing Storage account has a container with a name different from the cluster name you specified, you can use that container as well.
trans-unit.target: field, and there are no existing containers in that account, the container is created by default with the same name as the cluster name. If a container with the name of the cluster already exists, a sequence number will be appended to the container name. For example, mycontainer1, mycontainer2, and so on. However, if the existing Storage account has a container with a name different from the cluster name you specified, you can use that container as well.

trans-unit.source: If you chose to create a new storage or use storage from another Azure subscription, you must specify the default container name.
trans-unit.target: If you chose to create a new storage or use storage from another Azure subscription, you must specify the default container name.

trans-unit.source: Additional Storage Accounts
trans-unit.target: Additional Storage Accounts

trans-unit.source: If required, specify additional Storage accounts for the cluster. HDInsight supports multiple Storage accounts. There is no limit on the additional Storage accounts that can be used by a cluster. However, if you create a cluster by using the Azure portal, you have a limit of seven due to the UI constraints. Each additional Storage account you specify adds an extra
trans-unit.target: If required, specify additional Storage accounts for the cluster. HDInsight supports multiple Storage accounts. There is no limit on the additional Storage accounts that can be used by a cluster. However, if you create a cluster by using the Azure portal, you have a limit of seven due to the UI constraints. Each additional Storage account you specify adds an extra

trans-unit.source: Storage Account
trans-unit.target: Storage Account

trans-unit.source: page to the wizard where you can specify the account information. For example, in the screenshot above, no additional storage account is selected, and hence an extra page is not added to the wizard.
trans-unit.target: page to the wizard where you can specify the account information. For example, in the screenshot above, no additional storage account is selected, and hence an extra page is not added to the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Click the right arrow.
trans-unit.target: Click the right arrow.

trans-unit.source: On the Script Actions page, select the checkmark in the lower-right corner.
trans-unit.target: On the Script Actions page, select the checkmark in the lower-right corner.

trans-unit.source: Do not click the add script action button, as this tutorial does not require a customized cluster setup.
trans-unit.target: Do not click the add script action button, as this tutorial does not require a customized cluster setup.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Script Action to customize an HDInsight HBase cluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Script Action to customize an HDInsight HBase cluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This page can be used to customize the cluster during setup.
trans-unit.target: This page can be used to customize the cluster during setup.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To begin working with your new HBase cluster, you can use the procedures found in <link><linkText>Get started using HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To begin working with your new HBase cluster, you can use the procedures found in <link><linkText>Get started using HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the HBase cluster provisioned in the virtual network by using HBase Java RPC APIs
trans-unit.target: Connect to the HBase cluster provisioned in the virtual network by using HBase Java RPC APIs

trans-unit.source: Provision an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machine into the same Azure virtual network and the same subnet.
trans-unit.target: Provision an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machine into the same Azure virtual network and the same subnet.

trans-unit.source: So both the virtual machine and the HBase cluster use the same internal DNS server to resolve host names.
trans-unit.target: So both the virtual machine and the HBase cluster use the same internal DNS server to resolve host names.

trans-unit.source: To do so, you must choose the From Gallery option, and select the virtual network instead of a data center.
trans-unit.target: To do so, you must choose the From Gallery option, and select the virtual network instead of a data center.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <link><linkText>Create a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <link><linkText>Create a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A standard Windows Server 2012 image with a small VM size is sufficient.
trans-unit.target: A standard Windows Server 2012 image with a small VM size is sufficient.

trans-unit.source: When using a Java application to connect to HBase remotely, you must use the fully qualified domain name (FQDN).
trans-unit.target: When using a Java application to connect to HBase remotely, you must use the fully qualified domain name (FQDN).

trans-unit.source: To determine this, you must get the connection-specific DNS suffix of the HBase cluster.
trans-unit.target: To determine this, you must get the connection-specific DNS suffix of the HBase cluster.

trans-unit.source: To do that, use Curl to query Ambari, or use Remote Desktop to connect to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: To do that, use Curl to query Ambari, or use Remote Desktop to connect to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Curl - Use the following command:
trans-unit.target: Curl - Use the following command:

trans-unit.source: In the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) data returned, find the "host_name" entry.
trans-unit.target: In the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) data returned, find the "host_name" entry.

trans-unit.source: This will contain the FQDN for the nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This will contain the FQDN for the nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The portion of the domain name beginning with the cluster name is the DNS suffix.
trans-unit.target: The portion of the domain name beginning with the cluster name is the DNS suffix.

trans-unit.source: For example, mycluster.b1.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, mycluster.b1.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell - Use the following Azure PowerShell script to register the Get-ClusterDetail function, which can be used to return the DNS suffix:
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell - Use the following Azure PowerShell script to register the Get-ClusterDetail function, which can be used to return the DNS suffix:

trans-unit.source: After running the Azure PowerShell script, use the following command to return the DNS suffix by using the Get-ClusterDetail function.
trans-unit.target: After running the Azure PowerShell script, use the following command to return the DNS suffix by using the Get-ClusterDetail function.

trans-unit.source: Specify your HDInsight HBase cluster name, admin name, and admin password when using this command.
trans-unit.target: Specify your HDInsight HBase cluster name, admin name, and admin password when using this command.

trans-unit.source: This will return the DNS suffix.
trans-unit.target: This will return the DNS suffix.

trans-unit.source: For example, yourclustername.b4.internal.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, yourclustername.b4.internal.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: You can also use Remote Desktop to connect to the HBase cluster (you will be connected to the head node) and run ipconfig from a command prompt to obtain the DNS suffix.
trans-unit.target: You can also use Remote Desktop to connect to the HBase cluster (you will be connected to the head node) and run ipconfig from a command prompt to obtain the DNS suffix.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on enabling Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) and connecting to the cluster by using RDP, see <link><linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Azure portal[hdinsight-admin-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on enabling Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) and connecting to the cluster by using RDP, see <link><linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Azure portal[hdinsight-admin-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>hdinsight.hbase.dns.surffix</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>hdinsight.hbase.dns.surffix</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To verify that the virtual machine can communicate with the HBase cluster, use the command ping headnode0. from the virtual machine. For example, ping headnode0.mycluster.b1.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: To verify that the virtual machine can communicate with the HBase cluster, use the command ping headnode0. from the virtual machine. For example, ping headnode0.mycluster.b1.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: To use this information in a Java application, you can follow the steps in <link><linkText>Use Maven to build Java applications that use HBase with HDInsight (Hadoop)</linkText><title></title></link> to create an application.
trans-unit.target: To use this information in a Java application, you can follow the steps in <link><linkText>Use Maven to build Java applications that use HBase with HDInsight (Hadoop)</linkText><title></title></link> to create an application.

trans-unit.source: To have the application connect to a remote HBase server, modify the hbase-site.xml file in this example to use the FQDN for Zookeeper.
trans-unit.target: To have the application connect to a remote HBase server, modify the hbase-site.xml file in this example to use the FQDN for Zookeeper.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: For more information on name resolution in Azure virtual networks, including how to use your own DNS server, see <link><linkText>Name Resolution (DNS)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on name resolution in Azure virtual networks, including how to use your own DNS server, see <link><linkText>Name Resolution (DNS)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Provision an HBase cluster by using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Provision an HBase cluster by using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: To provision an HBase cluster by using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: To provision an HBase cluster by using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the following into the script pane:
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the following into the script pane:

trans-unit.source: Click Run Script, or press F5.
trans-unit.target: Click Run Script, or press F5.

trans-unit.source: To validate the cluster, you can either check the cluster from the Azure portal, or run the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet from the bottom pane:
trans-unit.target: To validate the cluster, you can either check the cluster from the Azure portal, or run the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet from the bottom pane:

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureHDInsightCluster
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureHDInsightCluster

trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you learned how to provision an HBase cluster.
